title: Ex-Nickelodeon Child Star Tylor Chase Spotted Homeless On California Streets
content: A former Nickelodeon actor has been spotted living on the streets of California. Tylor Chase, 36, who portrayed Martin Qwerly on Ned's Declassified School Survival Guide between 2004 and 2007, was seen in Riverside, Los Angeles.

title: Asim Munir Awarded Saudi Arabia's Highest Civilian Honour During Official Visit
content: Pakistan's Chief of Defence Forces, Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, has been awarded Saudi Arabia's highest civilian honour, the King Abdulaziz Medal of Excellence. Munir is currently on an official visit to the Kingdom.

title: Yogi Adityanath Takes "2 Namoonas" Dig, Akhilesh Yadav Flips The Script
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's "do namoone" jibe, apparently aimed at opposition leaders Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav, has drawn a sharp response from Yadav, who has twisted the Chief Minister's post

title: 68-Year-Old Man Loses Rs 23.5 Lakh In Cyber Fraud In Maharashtra
content: A 68-year-old man was allegedly cheated of Rs 23.5 lakh by cyber fraudsters who threatened him with digital arrest in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Monday.

title: Starlink In Crosshairs: How Russia Could Attack Musk's Conquering Of Space
content: Intelligence findings say the so-called "zone-effect" weapon would seek to flood Starlink orbits with hundreds of thousands of high-density pellets, potentially disabling multiple satellites at once.

title: Delhi Court Seeks Response From Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi On Plea In National Herald Case
content: The Delhi High Court on Monday asked Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi and others to respond to a plea by the ED challenging a trial court order refusing to take cognisance of its chargesheet against them in the National Herald case.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Is India Becoming 'Collateral Damage' In US' Tariff Wars?
content: As US-China economic tensions persist and intensify across select geographies, middle powers are increasingly adjusting trade policies to avoid direct confrontation with Washington.

title: Pope Francis To Charlie Kirk: Top Influential Figures Who Died In 2025
content: At least a dozen of the world's most influential figures across politics, spirituality, science, business, and sports died in 2025.

title: Kerala Minister Blames RSS' "Politics Of Hate" As Mob Kills Migrant Worker
content: Days after a migrant worker from Chhattisgarh was beaten to death in Kerala, state minister MB Rajesh said the man was a victim of the "politics of hate" propagated by the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) across the country.

title: Talha Saeed Leads Lashkar-e-Taiba Revival, Focuses On Educated Cadres, Online Classes
content: Lashkar-e-Taiba has decided to infuse fresh blood and go back to the basics. The first visible change is in the leadership, with most operations today headed by Talha Saeed, the son of Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed.

title: Jharkhand Woman Attacked With Boiling Oil After Resisting Harassment
content: In a shocking and gruesome incident, a woman was brutally attacked with boiling oil after she resisted an alleged molestation attempt by two youths in Gadi village under Leda Panchayat in the Mufassil police station area in Jharkhand

title: "In A Moment Of Anger, I Hit Him": BJP MLA On Slapping Auto Driver In Mumbai
content: On slapping an auto-rickshaw driver, BJP MLA Parag Shah, on Sunday, said that "it happened in a moment of anger", claiming that the driver was driving recklessly at a breakneck speed, which the female passenger in the rickshaw also complained of.

title: Bangladesh Student Leader Shot In Head As Violence Spirals Ahead Of Polls
content: As Bangladesh reels from the violence that erupted after the killing of Inqilab Manch spokesperson and student leader Usman Hadi, another student leader was shot in the head.

title: Pilot Body Urges "Calm, Restraint, Dignity" After Alleged Assault In Delhi
content: The advisory comes after a SpiceJet passenger alleged he was assaulted by an Air India Express pilot when he objected to the pilot cutting the boarding queue.

title: "I Think She Steams Them": Trump Talks About Melania's Undergarments At Rally
content: Describing the 2022 FBI raid at his Florida home, Trump said federal agents "went into my wife's closet" and "looked at her drawers," accusing them of messing with her wardrobe.

title: Teacher Hides Student's Death With 'Transfer' Lie, Asks Kids To Write Farewell Letters
content: A third-grade student in Tianjia'an District, Huainan, in China's Anhui Province, died of an illness, leaving his homeroom teacher, who had taught him for two years, in tears.

title: Karnataka To Auction Unused Liquor Licenses, Likely To Earn Rs 10,000 Crore
content: Siddaramaiah had proposed the transparent e-auction system in the 2025-26 budget presented on March 7, as part of efforts to mobilise additional resources for the state.

title: Senior Russian General Killed After Bomb Under Car Goes Off In Moscow
content: A senior Russian general was killed in southern Moscow on Monday after an explosive device placed under his car went off, investigators said in a statement.

title: Why Google, Apple, Microsoft Are Warning H-1B Visa Workers Not To Travel Abroad
content: Leading tech companies have advised their employees on work visas to avoid travelling outside the United States. The advisory comes as new visa screening requirements trigger lengthy delays at American embassies and consulates.

title: Border Force Constable Strays Into Bangladesh During Anti Smuggling Op Amid Fog, Returns Safely
content: A Border Security Force (BSF) constable, who inadvertently crossed into Bangladesh while attempting to foil a cattle smuggling bid along the India-Bangladesh border in West Bengal's Cooch Behar district, was safely returned to India by Sunday

content: Decision after police take into custody five activists of CPI(M) allegedly involved in attack on local office of IUML a day earlier

title: Ernakulam General Hospital in Kerala to conduct its first heart transplant; organ to go to Nepali girl

content: This programme seeks to reverse talent migration by facilitating tech professionals‚Äô return from metros and enabling GCCs, startups, and enterprises to scale in North Karnataka

content: In a case of reported honour killing, a pregnant young woman who had returned to the village few months after her intercaste marriage, was attacked with lethal weapons resulting in her death in the hospital. Her husband and in laws have also sustained injuries.

title: Steelers' Metcalf shoves fan during game in Detroit
content: Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf was involved in an altercation with a fan at Ford Field during the second quarter of Sunday's 29-24 win over the Detroit Lions.

title: Back injury forces Ravens' Jackson from SNF loss
content: Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson left Sunday night's game against the Patriots late in the first half because of a back injury. He said he hopes to play Saturday at Green Bay but will first have an MRI on Monday.

title: Lions own loss after late OPI calls: 'It's on us'
content: The Detroit Lions owned their big loss after late offensive pass interference calls, with coach Dan Campbell saying, "It's on us."

title: Maye rallies Pats after last week's 'wake-up call'
content: A week after failing to lead a winning drive against Buffalo, Patriots QB Drake Maye was given the same opportunity Sunday night at Baltimore -- and this time he delivered one of the signature performances of his career to clinch a playoff spot.

title: Sources: Red Sox acquire Contreras from Cards
content: The Red Sox have acquired first baseman Willson Contreras from the Cardinals in exchange for right-hander Hunter Dobbins and additional pitching, sources told ESPN.

title: Defiant Jags shift narrative, beat 1-seed Broncos
content: After a narrative-changing victory over the top-seeded Broncos in Denver, the Jaguars say they don't want anyone jumping on the bandwagon now.

title: Sources: Chiefs fear Minshew suffered ACL tear
content: One week after losing starter Patrick Mahomes to an ACL tear, Chiefs quarterback Gardner Minshew is feared to also have suffered a torn ACL, sources told ESPN.

title: Crosby leaps Lemieux as Pens' all-time top scorer
content: Sidney Crosby broke Mario Lemieux's franchise scoring record with a goal and an assist in the first period of the Pittsburgh Penguins' 4-3 win over the Montreal Canadiens on Sunday, giving him 645 goals and 1,079 assists for 1,724 points in 1,387 games.

content: Mario Cristobal and Joe Judge were among the notables to sound off with memorable lines after Round 1 of the College Football Playoff.

content: Technology-based processes will be strengthened by the commission to carry out recruitment in a timely manner

Now, they are seeking new alliances among other agrarian communities to revive their influence, evident from recent conferences and¬†panchayats, finds¬†Ashok Kumar

title: A model tribal school in Maharashtra battles water scarcity to fight migration
content: The Hiwali school has been seeking solar power and a KT dam or Kolhapur-Type Weir, a low-cost, gravity-based riverbed structure that acts as a small dam or barrage to store post-monsoon river flow for water supply

title: SIR in Tamil Nadu leads to deletion of 2.6 lakh more women than men from electoral rolls
content: Data points to marriage-related migration being the cause behind higher deletions of women‚Äôs names from electoral rolls

title: A gripping account from prison and a powerful argument for reforms
content: The book Oru Thooku Kaithiyin Vaakumoolam, authored by Selvam, who was once condemned to death for a murder, goes far beyond his personal story and his 31 years in prison. It provides a detailed account of the turf wars that engulfed Kanniyakumari district in the late 1980s

title: President grants assent to SHANTI Bill that opens up nuclear sector for private participation
content: The law enables private companies and joint ventures to build, own, operate and decommission nuclear power plants under a license from the government

title: Watch: Centre rejects mining claims, says Aravalli hills remain protected
content: The Centre has rejected reports that the definition of the Aravalli hills was changed to permit large-scale mining, citing a Supreme Court-ordered freeze on new leases. The clarification follows controversy over the ‚Äú100-metre‚Äù criterion used to define hills across states.

content: The announcement of the construction of Babri Masjid at Beldanga that has drawn large crowds to the venue; Every day, hundreds of people bring bricks to the venue and offer donations for the construction of the mosque

title: Bengal police warn against drawing a parallel between Bangladesh murder and Murshidabad lynching
content: The police warn of action against those attempting to communalise criminal incidents. Several BJP leaders had made references to the lynching of a father-son duo in Murshidabad in April 2025, against the backdrop of the recent murder of Dipu Chandra Das in Bangladesh.

title: Newly elected local body members in Ernakulam take oath amid cheers
content: A total of 2,220 representatives, elected to 111 local bodies in the district, took oath at different venues. As many as 1,467 members in 82 grama panchayats, 202 in 14 block panchayats, and 447 members in 13 municipalities also took oath at the respective centres

content: Opposition alleges attempt to create fear, says fringe Hindutva elements vitiating communal harmony of society

content: J&K Congress president and legislator Tariq Hamid Karra raised anti-government and pro-Gandhi slogans along with his supporters

content: The State Election Commission has not yet declared the results of all 286 municipal councils and nagar panchayats, which went to polls in two phases on December 2 and 20

title: BJP dominates panchayat polls in Arunachal, wins bulk of ZPM, GPM seats
content: The Peoples' Party of Arunachal (PPA) emerged as the second-largest force with 28 seats, while the Congress secured seven seats in the zila parishad constituencies

title: Coal block allocation case petitioner lawyer M.L. Sharma passes away
content: He filed multiple public interest litigations, notably on the abrogation of Article 370, the Pegasus spyware controversy, and the Rafale case

title: Bangladesh unrest: After Osman Hadi, another youth leader shot in head
content: Days after the killing of youth leader Sharif Osman Bin Hadi, another prominent youth leader, Motaleb Sikdar, was shot in head on Monday. He was taken to hospital in critical condition. This incident escalates concerns over political violence amidst heightened tensions following Hadi's death, which sparked widespread protests demanding justice.

title: 'Desh ke andar do namune hai': Yogi's veiled swipe at Akhilesh, Rahul; SP chief hits back
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath targeted Akhilesh Yadav and Rahul Gandhi, calling them "two specimens" who flee the country during discussions. He denied deaths from codeine syrup, stating action will be taken under the NDPS Act and linking the biggest wholesaler to the SP's tenure. Akhilesh Yadav criticized the personal attacks and alleged the racket originated from the Prime Minister's constituency.

title: Another husband murder in UP: Man hacked to death by wife, her lovers; head missing
content: A chilling murder in Chandausi has shocked residents after a woman allegedly conspired with her lovers to kill her husband. Rahul, a shoe trader, was brutally dismembered, with body parts found scattered. His wife, Ruby, initially reported him missing, but inconsistencies led to her detention along with two others. Evidence suggests the murder occurred at their home.

title: Watch: Newly elected Telangana leader dons bear costume to tackle village monkey menace
content: A newly elected sarpanch in Telangana donned a bear costume to scare away monkeys plaguing his village.  After traditional methods failed, Kummari Ranjith's unusual tactic aims to provide interim relief while urging the government for a permanent solution to the widespread menace causing crop damage and injuries.

title: Saudi Arabia honours Munir: Pak army chief gets top civilian award
content: Pakistan's Chief of Defence Forces, Field Marshal Syed Asim Munir, received Saudi Arabia's highest civilian honor, the King Abdulaziz Medal of Excellence, during his official visit. The award recognizes his professionalism and role in strengthening ties between the two nations. Munir reaffirmed Pakistan's commitment to Saudi Arabia's security and stability.

title: US on wrong path because of Nvidia, warns investor who predicted 2008 financial crisis
content: Michael Burry warns America's AI strategy is at a structural disadvantage due to heavy reliance on energy-intensive Nvidia chips. He highlights China's rapid power generation buildout and contrasts it with the US's slower grid development. Burry urges a shift towards more efficient AI-tuned ASICs, questioning Nvidia's soaring valuation and sustainability.

title: Vijay Hazare: After India snub, Shubman Gill back in spotlight; Punjab stack firepower
content: Shubman Gill returns to domestic cricket for the Vijay Hazare Trophy with Punjab after being left out of India's T20 World Cup squad.  He aims to regain form in the 50-over competition, supported by teammates Abhishek Sharma and Arshdeep Singh, as Punjab seek a strong title challenge in the domestic 50-over tournament.

title: Watch: Asim Munir says he felt 'divine intervention' during Op Sindoor
content: Pakistan's chief of defence forces, Asim Munir, claimed "divine help" during a military confrontation with India in May. He also urged Afghanistan's Taliban regime to choose between Pakistan and the Tehrik i Taliban Pakistan, stating that Afghans constitute the majority of militants infiltrating Pakistan.

title: How Long To Hold A Stock: Staying invested beats timing; compounding drives long-term gains
content: Enduring market volatility is key to unlocking significant equity returns.  Instead of fixed holding periods, focus on business cycles.  Long-term investors who stay invested through dull and scary phases, like the Titan example, are rewarded with substantial growth.  Missing just a few strong market days can drastically reduce returns, highlighting the importance of time in the market over timing it.

title: Microsoft‚Äôs new AI huddle: Nadella starts weekly meeting for engineers; no senior manager allowed
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella is accelerating AI development by empowering frontline technical employees. He's implemented weekly AI accelerator meetings where junior staff present directly to him, bypassing senior management. This unconventional approach aims to foster unfiltered insights and drive the company's AI transformation with urgency.

title: India-New Zealand FTA: Zero duty on 100% Indian exports - what the deal means for you
content: India and New Zealand have finalized a Free Trade Agreement, set to significantly boost bilateral trade and investment. The pact promises enhanced market access for goods and services, with New Zealand committing substantial investment.

title: Room heater buying guide: What to know and what not to miss before you buy this winter
content: Winter's chill demands a room heater, but choosing the right one is crucial. Beyond warmth, consider electricity consumption, safety features like overheat protection, and air quality.  Understanding wattage, energy efficiency ratings, and different heater types like oil-filled or ceramic will prevent hefty bills and ensure comfort. Prioritize safety and your specific needs for a cozy winter.

title: T20 WC: Finally Samson's moment of clarity? India's T20 'opener' looks to rise above chaos
content: Sanju Samson's long-awaited T20 World Cup opening spot comes after a decade of uncertainty and a revolving door of wicketkeepers. Despite strong performances, he faced confusion and batting order shifts, highlighting the team management's struggle for consistency in selecting their T20I wicketkeeper and openers.

title: After cutting Amazon stake: Jeff Bezos‚Äô ex-wife donates billions in 2025; 186 groups benefit
content: MacKenzie Scott has donated over $7.1 billion in 2025 to 186 organizations globally, including universities and environmental nonprofits, marking her largest annual giveaway. This significant philanthropic effort, detailed on her website Yield Giving, continues her focus on diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, with substantial contributions to institutions like Howard University and the UNCF.

title: Mumtaz calls Fardeen Khan ‚ÄòHeera Ladka,‚Äô opens up on daughter‚Äôs separation
content: Veteran actress Mumtaz has spoken about her daughter Natasha Madhvani's separation from Fardeen Khan, emphasizing that their bond remains strong. She praised Fardeen as a "heera ladka" and a caring husband, highlighting his visits to Natasha when she was unwell. Mumtaz also described him as a devoted father and expressed her hope for their reunion.

title: National Herald case: Delhi HC issues notice to Sonia, Rahul; seeks reply
content: The Delhi High Court has issued notices to Sonia and Rahul Gandhi, among others, in the National Herald money laundering case. The Enforcement Directorate is challenging a trial court's refusal to take cognisance of its complaint, alleging assets worth ‚Çπ2,000 crore were acquired for just ‚Çπ50 lakh. The matter is scheduled for further hearing in March 2026.

title: Chilling videos found on Bondi attacker's phone shows them training, justifying attack
content: New court documents reveal disturbing allegations about the Bondi Beach terror attack. The accused allegedly threw homemade bombs, including one disguised as a tennis ball, at a Jewish community event before opening fire. The father and son duo are believed to have acted together in a planned terrorist attack.

title: BrahMos and beyond: How UP is becoming India‚Äôs defence capital
content: India's supersonic prowess is taking flight from Lucknow with the inauguration of a state-of-the-art BrahMos Aerospace Integration and Testing Facility. This 200-acre complex is set to become the epicentre for producing the formidable BrahMos cruise missile, catering to surging domestic and international demand, including significant export orders.

title: Watch: Pakistan U19 team gets grand welcome; PM Shahbaz Sharif to host reception
content: Pakistan's Under 19 cricket team received a hero's welcome in Islamabad after their convincing Asia Cup final victory over India. The triumph, marked by a large public reception and a victory parade, has drawn praise from Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif and the PCB chairman, highlighting the significance of this rare junior-level success.

title: How Nicki Minaj went full MAGA with Erika Kirk in tow
content: Minaj appeared alongside Erika Kirk, the widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, at the AmericaFest gathering organised by Turning Point USA. During the on-stage conversation, she praised President Trump and Vice President JD Vance, describing them as leaders she admired and as figures young men could relate to. She also mocked California Governor Gavin Newsom using a nickname popularised by Trump, signalling comfort with the language commonly used within MAGA-aligned political spaces.

title: Priorities changed: Will Williamson wear NZ whites again? Test future 'series by series'
content: New Zealand's batting maestro Kane Williamson, 35, hinted at a potential Test retirement after the West Indies series, prioritising family and a flexible playing schedule.  His casual contract allows him to choose national assignments, with significant gaps before potential future series.  Despite nearing milestones, Williamson emphasises team success over personal records.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Hindu worker Dipu Das's lynching sparks outrage in Bengal
content: The lynching of Dipu Das in Bangladesh has ignited protests across Bengal, with Hindu organizations condemning the "barbarism" against minorities.  Das, a Hindu from a lower caste, was allegedly targeted for a promotion, with accusations of social media posts used as a pretext.  Activists are demanding action and a boycott of Bangladeshi goods.

title: Silver price hits record high! White metal crosses Rs 2.14 lakhs per kg
content: Silver reached a lifetime high on Monday, touching Rs 2,14,534 per kilogram on MCX and $68.65 per ounce spot, driven by strong central bank buying, ETF inflows, and industrial demand. Analysts anticipate a potential rise to Rs 2,25,000 by year-end due to supply disruptions and global cues.

title: 'I remember every face': 2016 UP highway gang rape survivors recount years of trauma
content: A survivor of the 2016 Bulandshahr gang rape, now studying law, shared her family's decade-long ordeal of harassment and relocation after the brutal attack. Conviction of five men offers hope, but the trauma and its impact on their lives and livelihoods remain profound.

title: Gold price prediction: What is the price outlook in the coming days?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are poised for a significant surge, potentially reaching ‚Çπ138,000-‚Çπ140,000, according to Manav Modi.  Silver has already seen remarkable gains, exceeding 120% year-to-date.  Despite record highs, investors are advised to buy on dips, with key support levels at ‚Çπ132,000.

title: Beckham family rift deepens: Brooklyn unfollows parents David and Victoria
content: Fresh rumours suggest tensions within the Beckham family are far from settled. Brooklyn Beckham and his parents, David and Victoria Beckham, have unfollowed each other on social media. Brooklyn is spending Christmas in the US with his wife Nicola Peltz's family. Victoria Beckham is reportedly trying to maintain a joyful festive season despite the absence. The family rift remains unresolved.

title: Oman launches first polymer one-rial banknote, circulation starts from January 2026
content: Oman has launched its first polymer one-rial banknote, which will start circulating from January 11, 2026. Made from durable polymer, the note features the Oman Botanic Garden on the front and the Sayyid Tariq bin Taimur Cultural Complex with Duqm Port and Refinery on the back. It includes advanced security features and limited collector editions will also be available.

title: ‚ÄòBlocked by the crowd‚Äô: Bangladesh police on mob lynching of Hindu worker Dipu; blame 'late call'
content: A Hindu garment worker was beaten to death by a mob in Bangladesh after allegations of hurting religious sentiments spread. Police admitted that a massive traffic jam and a furious crowd prevented them from reaching the victim, Dipu Chandra Das, in time. Authorities suggest a delayed call for help may have cost him his life.

title: T20 WC: Hardik Pandya hits top gear - Explosive return vs SA shows why he remains India's MVP
content: Hardik Pandya's stellar comeback from injury in the T20I series against South Africa has cemented his status as India's T20 MVP. His explosive batting and crucial wickets, including a 16-ball fifty, were instrumental in India's 3-1 series win. South Africa's coach lauded Pandya's impact, highlighting his vital role in the series.

title: Kerala mob lynching: CM vows strict action after mob beats Dalit labourer to death
content: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan assured strict action and justice for Ram Narayan Bakel, a Dalit migrant labourer from Chhattisgarh, who was beaten to death by a mob in Walayar, Palakkad. A special investigation team has been formed to probe the incident, which the CM termed unacceptable in a progressive society.

title: Anthony Joshua net worth 2025: Boxing earnings, career and Jake Paul fight payday
content: Anthony Joshua's net worth is estimated at ¬£195 million in 2025, with the majority earned from boxing purses. He also generates significant income from endorsements and property investments. Joshua is set to earn a guaranteed ¬£70 million from his upcoming fight against Jake Paul, a professionally sanctioned eight-round heavyweight bout.

title: 'Recovery isn‚Äôt optional': Why Chiefs Heiress Gracie hunt chose strength in 2025
content: Chiefs heiress Gracie Hunt reveals she gained 15 lbs during her 2025 fitness journey, explaining why strength, recovery, and long-term health mattered more than appearance. The Kansas City Chiefs owner‚Äôs daughter shares how intentional training, muscle gain, and consistency helped her finish the year stronger than she started.

title: Brittany Mahomes silent as Randi shares hope amid Patrick Mahomes recovery
content: Patrick Mahomes‚Äô season-ending knee injury has left the Chiefs in unfamiliar territory. While Brittany Mahomes has remained silent, his mother Randi publicly thanked fans for their prayers and support. As Mahomes begins a lengthy rehabilitation, the Chiefs face a rare playoff miss but remain optimistic about his full recovery and return in 2026.

title: J&K: 6-yr old boy finds 'toy' in garbage, turns out to be 'Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope'
content: Police in Jammu and Kashmir recovered a Chinese-made weapon-mountable telescope from a six-year-old boy in Sidhra, who reportedly found it in a garbage dump. A separate search operation was launched in Udhampur after terrorists allegedly stole food from a house before fleeing into a forest, days after a deadly encounter.

title: Trai's '12-minute-per-hour' cap: Regulator asks broadcasters to comply with limit
content: TRAI has urged broadcasters to comply with the 12-minute-per-hour advertising cap, despite the rule being under judicial review. The regulator insists the regulation remains applicable, even as the Delhi High Court has restrained coercive action. Broadcasters are concerned about the enforcement due to existing financial pressures and declining revenues.

title: Church scare in Singapore: Indian-origin man charged over terror threat
content: An Indian-origin Singaporean man, Kokulananthan Mohan, faces charges for a false terrorist threat at St Joseph's Church. He allegedly placed a fabricated device, causing services to be cancelled. Preliminary probes indicate he acted alone, with no terror or religious motive found. Mohan is undergoing psychiatric evaluation.

title: 'Dhurandhar' and Deepika : Paparazzi tease Ranveer at airport
content: Power couple Ranveer Singh and Deepika Padukone turned heads at the Mumbai airport in coordinated black and grey winter wear. Ranveer, basking in his film's massive box office success, was cheered by photographers. The spy thriller is now his career's biggest hit, nearing Rs 1,000 crore globally. Deepika, busy with upcoming projects, joined him for the stylish airport spotting.

title: Samantha mobbed at Hyderabad event: Actor faces crowd chaos during public appearance
content: Following a similar incident with Nidhhi Agerwal, Samantha Ruth Prabhu faced overwhelming crowds at a Hyderabad event, struggling to reach her vehicle amidst security. The event highlighted concerns about fan behavior and preparedness of management teams for public appearances.

title: GRAP Stage-IV in Gurugram explained: Timings changed, WFH pushed for offices
content: The Deputy Commissioner Gurugram has implemented revised office timings and a work from home advisory in response to deteriorating air quality. The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has invoked Stage-IV of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) in Delhi-NCR. State Government offices will operate from 09:30 AM to 05:30 PM, municipal offices from 08:30 AM to 04:30 PM, and private offices are advised to allow 50% staff to work remotely until further notice, as posted on X.

title: 'No energy left': Rohit Sharma makes candid revelations; opens up about 2023 World Cup final
content: Former India captain Rohit Sharma revealed he considered quitting cricket after the 2023 ODI World Cup final loss to Australia. The emotional toll of the defeat, after investing heavily since becoming captain, left him feeling drained. It took months of recovery and self-reflection to regain his passion for the sport.

title: 'Is this your father‚Äôs car?': Rapido driver assaults woman, hurls abuses in Gurgaon
content: A Rapido cab driver was arrested within hours for allegedly misbehaving with a woman, hurling abuses, and dropping her on a deserted road late in the evening. The incident occurred after the woman requested the driver to lower loud music, leading to an aggressive confrontation and her feeling unsafe.

title: Transfer portal: Tracking who intends to move
content: College football's transfer portal officially opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. Once the portal opens, players have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Mid-air scare: Mumbai bound Air India flight returns to Delhi after one engine shutdown
content: VT-ALS returned safely to Delhi after one engine shutdown . the twin engine aircraft had taken off as AI 887 for Mumbai at 6.10 am and was back around 6.52 am, per flight tracing sites . passengers boarding commenced at 9.06 am and the alternate aircraft is expected to take off around 10 am .
